verdict: Efficient lead generation ($36 CPA) for wedding venue; needs structural expansion and conversion value tracking

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 24 conversions tracked — good volume for an $865 spend

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: 8.3% CVR and $36 CPA — needs verification that only venue inquiries/calls are Primary

checks.name: Conversion value assignment
checks.finding: No conversion values — wedding venues have high AOV ($5K-$30K+). Even estimated values would transform bidding strategy

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: Wedding venue queries are seasonal — terms should be reviewed quarterly

checks.name: Wasted spend assessment
checks.finding: $36 CPA and 8.3% CVR is excellent — minimal waste apparent

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: CTM prefix with service type — clear naming

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: Single campaign — appropriate for small budget but limits testing

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: No brand campaign. Wedding couples search by venue name during research — brand terms likely going to PMax or competitors

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: No PMax — wedding venues are highly visual; PMax with venue photos/video tours would be very effective

checks.name: Search CTR performance
checks.finding: 11.3% CTR is exceptional — strong keyword-to-ad-to-search intent alignment

checks.name: Keyword targeting quality
checks.finding: Wedding venue keywords are well-targeted given the high CTR and CVR

checks.name: Search volume opportunity
checks.finding: 2,566 impressions — may be seasonal. Verify if budget is limiting or market is small

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: 11.3% CTR is outstanding for wedding venue queries (benchmark ~5-7%)

checks.name: Ad freshness
checks.finding: Ad creative testing not verified — seasonal messaging updates recommended for wedding trends

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Bidding strategy not verified — with 24 conv/month, Max Conversions would be effective

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: Yandina Station is location-specific — verify targeting covers relevant source markets for destination weddings

checks.name: Customer Match lists
checks.finding: No remarketing audiences — couples research venues over weeks/months before deciding

quickWins.action: Add estimated conversion values — wedding venue inquiries lead to $5K-$30K+ bookings. Even $10K average value transforms optimization
Build remarketing audiences — wedding couples research for weeks before booking
Launch brand Search campaign — couples search by venue name during shortlisting phase
Verify conversion tracking — confirm inquiries and calls are Primary, not page views
Review search terms for seasonal wedding planning queries to capture

items: Add conversion values — even estimated values based on average wedding booking
Verify conversion tracking — ensure qualified inquiries only
Build remarketing audiences from site visitors (long consideration cycle for weddings)
Launch PMax campaign with stunning venue photography and video tours
Expand keyword coverage: reception venues, outdoor weddings, destination weddings in the area
Add seasonal ad copy for peak engagement/wedding planning seasons
Increase budget if SIS is below 70% — currently well under $30/day
Test Demand Gen for reaching couples in early planning stages
Partner with wedding planners for Customer Match audience building
Seasonal budget increases during peak engagement season (Dec-Feb, Jun-Jul)
Implement offline conversion tracking when inquiry leads to booking
